definition: to jump the gun/to make a false start
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
(of an animal) to paw (the ground)
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off

sentences.english: Breaking into the palaces, they snatched everything of value.
sentences.chinese: 他们闯进皇宫，把值钱的东西都抢跑了。

sentences.english: The runners called back because one of them beat the pistol.
sentences.chinese: 赛跑运动员们被叫回来，殷为他们中有一人抢跑了。

sentences.english: When he unexpectedly false started, he had the stadium audibly chuckling.
sentences.chinese: 当他出人意料地抢跑时，整个体育场都笑出声来。

sentences.english: In the 100-meter dash he jumped the gun several times because of nervousness.
sentences.chinese: 在100米赛跑中他因为紧张抢跑了好几次。

definition: the starting line (of a race)/scratch line (in a relay race)
see 搶風|抢风[qiang1 feng1]
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
key moment/decisive opportunity
to fall behind/to drop out
to go with the tide/to blindly follow the crowd/to follow the trend
to overtake on a bend (driving)/(fig.) taking opportunity of tight corners to make swift progress (economy etc)
to dive (into water)/(sports) diving/to commit suicide by jumping into water/(fig.) (of stock prices etc) to fall dramatically
to sprint/to spurt/to dash/big effort
to play yabao (a gambling game)/(fig.) to gamble on/to take one's chance/to try one's luck
foresight/having foresight/person of foresight
(of an animal) to paw (the ground)
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
hurdles/hurdle race (athletics)
to enter the venue for a meeting/to enter into an examination/to enter a stadium, arena etc
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
to fight over/to scramble for
to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
